title: (x) "Destricted" black serif face - Times Modern Black {Nick Cooke}
author: Biff

comments.content:
Times Modern Black, but the D looks narrower.

Destricted?

Nick Cooke

There's a good chance its ITC Bookman, (85% sure...ish)  
Stephen

Stephen – are you looking at the same thing as me?

Nick Cooke

Sorry that's ITC Bookman 'medium' kinda forgot their so dam many Bookmans'

Stephen
that is a crazy film, not one to watch with your mother

Have I stepped into a parallel universe?

Nick Cooke
I tried to enter this thread but was diverted to _The Twilight Zone!_ What in the blue blazes is happening here!?! :^P

OK, I checked everything. Nick, I think you nailed it. Apart from the narrower UC 'D', [Times Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017083937/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.8295.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=60&sampleText=Destricted&sampleSize=74) is indeed a perfect match.

Stephen, why do you think this is ITC Bookman? The sample has sharp, pointy serifs, while ITC Bookman's got [chunky rectangular ones](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017083937/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.125939.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=60&sampleText=Destricted&sampleSize=48). Any amount of [squooshing](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017083937/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squooshed) the type will never get you anywhere close.
BTW Nick, [Destricted](http://web.archive.org/) is "a compilation of erotic films intended to illuminate the points where art meets sexuality." Indeed not one to watch with your mother.
Thanks guys. Very insightful. I had no idea it was type for an erotic film.
Times Modern is no longer available. I’ve posted as much as I know [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017083937/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/3368/the-other-times-modern).
